name: W._C._Fields
text:
W. C. Fields
"As W. C. Fields would say, 'I'd rather be here than Philadelphia.'"
 ―Dale Cooper
William Claude Dukenfield, better known as W. C. Fields, was a vaudeville performer.
Early in his career, he performed his juggling act at the Bijou Opera House in Twin Peaks, Washington.
On February 24, 1989, Dale Cooper quoted Fields as he arrived in Twin Peaks.
Behind the scenes
W. C. Fields (January 29, 1880 – December 25, 1946) was an American comedian, actor, juggler, and writer. He began his career in vaudeville before reaching stardom on Broadway and appearing on radio and in film.
